titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Henry Rust O'Brien (1891-1970) served in the U.S. Public Health Service's Bureau of Mines in Pittsburgh, with the International Health Board of the Rockefeller Foundation in Thailand from 1921 to 1924, and with the Board of Foreign Missions of the Presbyterian Church in the USA, serving in Chiang Mai, Thailand, as a member of the staff of the McCormick Hospital. His wife, Mary L. Phillips Carr O'Brien, served in Thailand alongside him. The couple returned to the United States in 1931.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence, reports and photographs from the O'Briens' time serving as missionaries in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Photographs include an image of the Chiang Mai Mission Group, 1929, and an image of the cook at Chiang Mai Mission, 1929. The correspondence dates from 1926 to 1929 and is sent from Mary Lou O'Brien to Mrs. Jones and "Friends" (possibly meaning members of the sponsoring church). One letter of three pages is in the form of a poem, made up of rhyming couplets. The collection also includes two reports written by Mary Lou O'Brien in 1928.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Henry Rust O'Brien papers (RG 394).
